title: Hôtel de Villeroy (Paris, 7th arrondissement)
text:
The Hôtel de Villeroy is an 18th-century building in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>, built on the initiative of Antoine Hogguer of Saint-Gall, Baron de Presles for his mistress, the actress <a href="Charlotte%20Desmares">Charlotte Desmares</a>.
It is located at no 78 rue de Varenne in the <a href="7th%20arrondissement%20of%20Paris">7th arrondissement</a> of Paris, not far from the <a href="H%C3%B4tel%20de%20Matignon">Hôtel de Matignon</a>, located on the same street. Since 1881, it has housed the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Agriculture%20%28France%29">French Ministry of Agriculture and Food</a>.
Its current occupant is <a href="Julien%20Denormandie">Julien Denormandie</a>, Minister of Agriculture and Food since July 6, 2020.
